perturbation.original_text: 3.00 Company grants to Investor, for the duration of the Option Period, a worldwide, royalty-free, non-exclusive, irrevocable license (with the right to grant sublicenses to Affiliates) under the Patents to practice the methods therein described and claimed and to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using such methods, and to make Improvements, and to engage in any activity which would give rise to a claim of infringement (direct or indirect or otherwise) of one or more of the Patents in the absence of a license.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.00 Company grants to Investor, for the duration of the Option Period, a worldwide, royalty-bearing, non-exclusive, revocable license (without the right to grant sublicenses) under the Patents to practice the methods therein described and claimed and to make and have made, use, offer to sell, sell and import products made using such methods, and to make Improvements, and to engage in any activity which would give rise to a claim of infringement (direct or indirect or otherwise) of one or more of the Patents in the absence of a license.
perturbation.explanation: By changing "royalty-free" to "royalty-bearing," "irrevocable" to "revocable," and removing the sublicense clause we introduce uncertainty. The original grants a strong, permanent right, while the modified version allows for royalties, revocation and no sublicensing which alters the rights granted to Investor. This creates a contradiction on the strength and conditions of the license grant.

perturbation.original_text: 5.02 Investor shall own all right, title and interest in any Improvement made jointly by Company and Investor ("Joint Improvements") during the term of this IP Agreement, and Company agrees to and hereby does assign to Investor any right, title and interest it may otherwise have in any Joint Improvement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.02 Company shall own all right, title and interest in any Improvement made jointly by Company and Investor ("Joint Improvements") during the term of this IP Agreement, and Investor agrees to and hereby does assign to Company any right, title and interest it may otherwise have in any Joint Improvement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly states that the Investor owns all right, title and interest in any Improvement, made jointly by the Company and Investor. The modified version directly contradicts this by stating that the Company owns all right, title and interest in the same 'Joint Improvements'. This contradiction creates ambiguity about the ownership of jointly developed improvements.

perturbation.original_text: 16.03 The following provisions of this IP Agreement shall survive termination of this IP Agreement: Article I, Article II, Articles 3.08 and 3.09, Article V (as to Improvements made or acquired during the term of the IP Agreement), Article VI, and Articles VIII-XVIII. In addition, for as long as there continues to exist Technical Information of use by Investor in its business, any rights or licenses Investor has in Technical Information under this Agreement shall survive termination of this IP Agreement under Article 16.00 but not termination under Articles 16.01 or 16.02 for material breach.
perturbation.changed_text: 16.03 The following provisions of this IP Agreement shall survive termination of this IP Agreement: Article I, Article II, Articles 3.08 and 3.09, Article V (as to Improvements made or acquired during the term of the IP Agreement), Article VI, and Articles VIII-XVIII. In addition, for as long as there continues to exist Technical Information of use by Investor in its business, no rights or licenses Investor has in Technical Information under this Agreement shall survive termination of this IP Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the rights or licenses the Investor has in Technical Information, shall survive termination of this IP Agreement under Article 16.00 but not termination under Articles 16.01 or 16.02 for material breach. The modified version directly contradicts this by stating that the rights or licenses the Investor has in Technical Information, shall not survive termination of this IP Agreement. This contradiction creates ambiguity about the rights or licenses the Investor has in Technical Information.
